title: Predicting Hearing Loss in the Chinese Middle-aged and Elderly: A Machine Learning Approach Using Clinical and Demographic Data
authors: Jinyuan Yang, Xin Tan, Guojie Dong, Sijing Fan, Hongyun Zheng, Yicong Cui, Wen Fang, Chui Kong
publish: 2025 19th International Conference on Complex Medical Engineering (CME)
abstract: Hearing impairment (HI) is an increasingly prevalent public health concern among aging populations, yet scalable and effective screening tools remain limited. Within East Asia, China bears a disproportionately high HI burden-despite comprising 87% of the regional population aged 45 and above, it accounts for 97% of reported cases. To develop a predictive framework, we analyzed data from 7,901 individuals aged 45+ in the China Health and Retirement Longitudinal Study (CHARLS). Using LASSO regression for variable selection, 22 key demographic, clinical, and behavioral features were identified. A suite of seven machine learning models-including logistic regression, support vector machine (SVM), gradient boosting machine (GBM), neural network, XGBoost, AdaBoost, and LightGBM-was trained and evaluated using a 70/30 train-test split. Model interpretability was enhanced through SHAP analysis applied to the best-performing algorithm. Notably, our results revealed significant geographic variation in HI prevalence, ranging from 2.7% in Zhejiang to 10.2% in Inner Mongolia-a 3.8-fold disparity. Among the models, GBM yielded the highest predictive accuracy (AUROC: 0.887 in training; 0.678 in testing), and SHAP analysis highlighted age, cognitive status, and depressive symptoms as leading contributors to HI risk. Furthermore, the model demonstrated clinical applicability through individualized risk assessment, as illustrated by profiling a high-risk 52 -year-old participant. In summary, our findings underscore substantial spatial and regional differences in HI distribution across China and validate the potential of a GBM-SHAP-based framework as a practical and interpretable tool for early HI risk detection. This approach supports precision public health efforts by enabling targeted screening strategies in aging and resource-constrained populations.

title: A Decision Support System of Journal Accreditation Readiness Using ANP-TOPSIS for Publishing Institutions
authors: Eko Didik Widianto, Hadiyanto, Teddy Mantoro, Diovany Bryan Gunawan, Dania Eridani
publish: 2025 12th International Conference on Information Technology, Computer, and Electrical Engineering (ICITACEE)
abstract: Journal self-assessment by publishing institutions to evaluate their journal readiness for accreditation leads to inconsistencies in the evaluation of each criterion and indicator. This study proposed a model for evaluating journal readiness that considers the relationships and dependencies between accreditation criteria and indicators. We employed the Analytic Network Process (ANP) method to weigh eight main criteria and 39 indicators of journal accreditation, and the Technique for Order of Preference by Similarity to Ideal Solution (TOPSIS) method to evaluate the alternatives on their accreditation readiness. This model has successfully demonstrated the level of journal readiness for accreditation based on its preference values. The model highlighted the consistency of the journals' evaluation by emphasizing the interdependency between criteria and indicators in journal accreditation, as compared to manual calculation using additive weighting.

title: Multi-label ECG classification using a reduced-lead configuration
authors: Amal El Bekkaoui, Nabaouia Louridi, Samira Douzi, Bouabid Ouahidi
publish: 2025 11th International Conference on Optimization and Applications (ICOA)
abstract: Cardiovascular disease (CVD) continues to be a global public health challenge, making scalable and reliable diagnostics necessary. Electrocardiogram (ECG) is a cornerstone in the assessment of the heart, but its conventional 12-lead configuration has logistical and economic hurdles to initiate in low-resource settings. We present, to oppose this, a deep learning model for automated ECG classification using a sparse three-lead configuration (Leads I, II, and V2), selected because of their outstanding diagnostic yield. With the CPSP 2018 dataset, we employed a clean preprocessing pipeline to handle noise and baseline drift and thereafter trained on a ResNet-34 convolutional neural network to predict nine distinct cardiac conditions. We achieved excellent class-specific F1 scores of 0.90 for atrial fibrillation (AF), incomplete atrioventricular block (IAVB), left bundle branch block (LBBB), and right bundle branch block (RBBB), which indicate the strength of the model in detection of life-threatening arrhythmias and conduction defects. Our experiments demonstrate that a low-lead setup, combined with a robust deep learning model, can offer robust diagnostic accuracy. With better accessibility without compromising accuracy, our approach presents an appealing solution to enable scalable ECG screening at scale in resource-limited healthcare environments.

title: The Generation Method of Two-Scale Sequence Generating Arbitrary Mother Wavelet with High Accuracy Using Machine Learning for Discrete Wavelet Transform
authors: Yamato Imai, Minoru Komatsu, Hiroki Matsumoto
publish: 2025 24th International Symposium on Communications and Information Technologies (ISCIT)
abstract: The wavelet transform is an analytical method that simultaneously captures the characteristics of a signal from both the time domain and the frequency domain, and it is suitable for analyzing non-stationary or nonlinear signals. In particular, various speed-up methods for Discrete Wavelet Transform(DWT) enable this transform to be performed faster than Continuous Wavelet Transform(CWT). In DWT, the Mother Wavelet(MW) is determined from a set two-scale sequence. However, there are not many types of two-scale sequences commonly used for analysis. Therefore, when we perform DWT to analyze signals, we may not be able to use suitable MW for each signal. To address this problem, there is a method that uses machine learning to generate a two-scale sequence corresponding to an arbitrary MW. Based on this conventional method, we can perform DWT using an arbitrary MW. Where, in the conventional method, we use difference approximation for calculating the gradient of the loss function. Hence, the value of the loss function does not decrease sufficiently when many elements of the Discrete Wavelet Basis(DWB) and sample values of MW are used for calculating the loss function. Therefore, the generated two-scale sequence does not generate the MW with high accuracy. Because of this, in DWT using two-scale sequences generated by conventional method, we cannot perform accurate analysis. In this study, we accurately calculate the gradient of the loss function for each parameter in the machine learning model. This allows us to construct models in which the loss function decreases sufficiently even when many elements of DWB and samples of MW are used for calculating the loss function. From the above, we propose a method for generating two-scale sequences that generate MW with high accuracy. Based on this method, we can perform DWT using a two-scale sequence that generates arbitrary MW with high accuracy. Therefore, we think that accurate analysis can be performed in DWT using the two-scale sequence generated by the proposed method.

title: Supervised Classification of Resting-State fMRI Biomarkers for Early Detection of Alzheimer’s Disease
authors: Ziqi Liu, Zhilin Zhang, Jinglong Wu, Qi Dai, Youshan Ma, Ting Jiang, Linghao Sun, Lichang Yao, Jingjing Yang
publish: 2025 19th International Conference on Complex Medical Engineering (CME)
abstract: Alzheimer’s disease (AD) is an irreversible neurodegenerative disorder. Resting-state functional magnetic resonance imaging (rs-fMRI) provides several metrics that capture neural activity, including the amplitude of low-frequency fluctuations (ALFF), fractional ALFF (fALFF), regional homogeneity (ReHo), and voxel-mirrored homotopic connectivity. However, the integration of these metrics with graph-theoretical metrics and machine learning techniques for accurate early detection of AD is still not well established. To address this problem, this study systematically combined the above analysis methods and employed multiple machine learning models to stage the different phases of AD. The results showed that, from the cognitively normal stage to the early mild cognitive impairment stage, ALFF, fALFF, and ReHo were altered, classification with logistic regression achieved an area under the curve (AUC) of $\mathbf{9 7. 5 \%}$. From the late mild cognitive impairment stage to AD, significant changes were observed in smallworldness metrics, and logistic regression reached an AUC of $96.8 \%$. These findings deepen the understanding of AD’s neural mechanisms and highlight functional metrics based on rs-fMRI as promising biomarkers for early detection.

title: Ancillary Services of A Triple-Port Smart Transformer
authors: Mohamed Taha Gabriel, Diaa-Eldin A. Mansour, Takashi Yoshida, Masahito Shoyama, Sobhy M. Abdelkader
publish: 2025 IEEE Conference on Power Electronics and Renewable Energy (CPERE)
abstract: Smart transformers have recently gained considerable attention for their ability to provide essential ancillary services to the power grid, such as voltage regulation, frequency support, reactive power compensation, and renewable energy integration. In this paper, a triple-port smart transformer based on a triple active bridge (TAB) topology is proposed to interface a photovoltaic (PV) system, a battery energy storage system (BESS), and local AC loads. The TAB topology enables flexible and bidirectional power flow control among the three ports. Ancillary services supported by the system include voltage regulation and soft load reduction, where load power is reduced by intentionally lowering the supply voltage rather than disconnecting loads. The effect of load-side voltage variations on the controllability of power flow is analyzed, and based on this analysis, a decoupled controller is designed to enhance system performance. Comprehensive simulations are carried out using MATLAB/Simulink to validate the system architecture and control approach. Additionally, a scaled-down hardware prototype is developed to experimentally verify the proposed concept.

title: An Efficient ANN-Based Model of a Bifilar Helix Antenna for GPS and GLONASS Signal Reception
authors: Nemanja Perić, Nebojša Dončov, Olivera Pronić-Rančić, Zoran Stanković, Ksenija Mladenović
publish: 2025 17th International Conference on Advanced Technologies, Systems and Services in Telecommunications (TELSIKS)
abstract: In this paper, a neural model of a bifilar helix antenna was developed to predict resonant frequencies, $S_{11}$ parameter values, axial ratio, and antenna gain at those resonant frequencies. The model’s input parameters are the physical characteristics of the bifilar helix antenna: the helix radius, the spacing between turns, and the helix wire thickness. The neural model consists of Multilayer Perceptron (MLP) networks. To generate the training and test sets for training and validating the neural model, an electromagnetic (EM) model based on the Method of Moments (MoM) was used. The advantages and limitations of both modeling approaches are discussed.

title: Vibration and Acoustic Monitoring of Wind Turbine Nacelle and Automatic Fault Identification
authors: Linhe Liu, Yanjie Shen, Yingjie Wu, Yong Li, Yang Li, Guangqi Qu, Shun Wang
publish: 2025 International Conference on Equipment Intelligent Operation and Maintenance (ICEIOM)
abstract: This paper proposes an automatic diagnostic method for the field diagnostic lag problem of typical faults of wind turbine transmission chain. The method taps the characteristic frequency and amplitude of main shaft bolt loosening, gearbox pitting and shaft system imbalance, and designs corresponding automatic diagnosis algorithms: for main shaft bolt loosening, the rotational speed is estimated by the three-level meshing frequency, combined with the vibration peak characteristics to determine the fault; for gearbox pitting, the high-speed shaft rotational frequency and the magnitude of the sideband of the meshing frequency are utilized to identify the fault; for the blade shaft system imbalance, the amplitude of the blade rotational frequency is compared with the threshold value to determine the fault. For the blade shaft system imbalance, the fault is determined by comparing the blade rotational frequency amplitude with the threshold value. Finally, offline verification testing of laboratory data has confirmed that this method can effectively diagnose typical faults in wind turbines, providing strong support for the wind power industry in reducing fault rates and maintenance costs.

title: Strategic Development of a Hydrogen Supply Chain in Corsica: a Multi-criteria Analysis
authors: Tchougoune Moustapha Mai, Mohamed Hajajji, Catherine Azzaro-Pantel, Maude Chin Choi, Christian Cristofari
publish: 2025 IEEE Conference on Power Electronics and Renewable Energy (CPERE)
abstract: A multi-objective framework for hydrogen supply chain (HSC) planning is developed for island contexts, incorporating Mixed-Integer Linear Programming (MILP) over multiple time periods. The model minimizes total system cost, greenhouse gas (GHG) emissions, and a risk index criteria. The case study of Corsica is considered, using Geographic Information Systems (GIS) for spatial analysis and infrastructure locating. The 2050 future design of the HSC is determined including site selection, capacity sizing, and technology choices. The proposed m-TOPSIS-based multi objectives solution shows a decentralized infrastructure with a levelized cost of hydrogen of € $6.55 / \mathrm{kg}$, and greenhouse gas emissions under $2 \mathrm{kgCO}_{2} \mathrm{e} / \mathrm{kg} \mathrm{H}_{2}$. The study also integrates water availability and tourism-induced demand variation as key drivers of energy planning in insular regions.

title: ECG Classification Based on QRS Filtering and BiLSTM Neural Networks
authors: Zerui Li, Xinjing Song, Hong Zhu, Weijun Yan
publish: 2025 19th International Conference on Complex Medical Engineering (CME)
abstract: Cardiovascular disease (CVD) is one of the biggest threats to global health, including a variety of health problems affecting the heart and blood vessels, and has high morbidity, disability and mortality. The MATLAB R2018b platform is used to explore and process the data set. After the QRS wave adjustment algorithm and the adaptive threshold algorithm are used to process the input of the optimized data for the four kinds of heart beat recognition of arrhythmia, the deep learning method of BILSTM neural network is trained in combination with the PyCharm platform. Firstly, the QRS wave location detection algorithm and adaptive threshold algorithm are used to intercept the QRS wave of the characteristic band by using band-pass filtering combined with sliding window integral and other technologies. The BILSTM input signal is debugged, and the BILSTM network is trained to extract the QRS band characteristics of the heart rhythm and identify the abnormal heart rhythm. The overall accuracy rate is 99.12%, which achieves a good recognition effect.

title: Automated Environmental Monitoring for Bok Choy Hydroponic System in Greenhouse
authors: Yulintyandra Puja Antanita, Brahmantya Aji Pramudita, Porman Pangaribuan
publish: 2025 12th International Conference on Information Technology, Computer, and Electrical Engineering (ICITACEE)
abstract: Bok choy (Brassica chinensis <tex xmlns:mml="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">$L$</tex>.) is a type of vegetables that is widely consumed and has many benefits, such vascular health and reducing the risk of cancer. However, the Bok choy cultivation is challenging. Bok choy is very sensitive to environmental changes. Traditional soil-based cultivation comes with some limitations that can affect the Bok choy growth. Hydroponics system is a soilless cultivation method that effectively addresses the challenges of traditional farming. This system can increase productivity without relying on the soil conditions and required maintenance. However, the hydroponics method alone cannot ensure the ideal environmental conditions for the growth and development of Bok choy plants. This study presents the development of an automated microclimate management system designed for hydroponic cultivation of Bok choy in a greenhouse environment. To optimize conditions for plant growth, the system employs sensors and actuators to continuously analyze and automatically regulate key environment factors, including temperature, humidity, light intensity, water level, and flow rate. The Arduino microcontroller processes the real-time data collected by DHT11, BH1750, HC-SR04, and a water flowmeter in the proposed system to power actuators such as exhaust fans, LED grow lights, mist sprayers, and water pumps. The system maintained internal temperatures between 25° C to 28° C, with an average humidity level of 78.14 %, and light intensity was consistently kept above 2500 lux. The irrigation system ensured a steady water supply at <tex xmlns:mml="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">$5.04 \mathrm{L} / \mathrm{m}$</tex>, while the LED grow light operated efficiently under low light settings.

title: On Solution of Mixed Problem in Colombeau Algebras
authors: Abdelmjid Benmerrous, Lalla Saadia Chadli, M’hamed Elomari, Abdelaziz Moujahid
publish: 2025 11th International Conference on Optimization and Applications (ICOA)
abstract: This study proves the existence and uniqueness of a generalized solution for a mixed problem within the framework of Colombeau algebra by using Gronwall’s lemma.

title: IEEE Standard for Voltage-Endurance Testing of Form-Wound Coils and Bars for Hydro Generators
authors: N/A
publish: N/A
abstract: The test parameters and acceptance criteria for voltage-endurance testing of form-wound bars and coils for use in large hydro generators are covered in this standard.

title: Research on Vehicle State Recognition Based on Improved CNN
authors: Hao Hu, Fuzhou Feng, Junzhen Zhu, Chao Song, Zhenggang Wen, Hailiang Liu
publish: 2025 International Conference on Equipment Intelligent Operation and Maintenance (ICEIOM)
abstract: To address the limitations of traditional Prognostics and Health Management (PHM) methods, such as complex signal processing, reliance on expert experience, and low recognition accuracy, this paper proposes a vehicle state recognition method based on an improved Convolutional Neural Network (improved CNN). First, vibration signals of the vehicle under different operating conditions are collected. Subsequently, the acquired vibration data is divided into training and testing sets. Finally, the data is input into the improved CNN for feature extraction and model training to achieve recognition of different vehicle operating conditions. Experimental results demonstrate that the proposed method achieves a classification accuracy of 99.3% across four vehicle operating conditions. This approach effectively identifies different vehicle states with high recognition precision.

title: An Approach to the Lifecycle Management of Virtualized FRMCS Applications as a Service
authors: Ivaylo I. Atanasov, Evelina N. Pencheva, Dragomira V. Dimitrova
publish: 2025 17th International Conference on Advanced Technologies, Systems and Services in Telecommunications (TELSIKS)
abstract: Future Railway Mobile Communication System (FRMCS) is a successor of the legacy railway communication system. Based on fifth generation mobile communication system, it enables automated and more efficient railway operation and enhances passenger services. The FRMCS critical and performance applications could be isolated from its underlying operating system and hardware using the technology of Network Function Virtualization (NFV). The paper presents an approach to the centralized management of virtualized FRMCS applications which simplifies deployment, improve security, and flexibility to access the FRMCS applications from different devices and locations. Basic management functionality related to FRMCS application lifecycle is identified and designed as a RESTful service.

title: Modeling of Turboshaft Engine Turbine Tip Clearance Parameters and Performance Analysis Based on Uncertainty Theory
authors: Youwei Qiao, Liang Bai, Xiaoyi Tang, Suili Yang, Zhihuan Wei, Di Su
publish: 2025 International Conference on Equipment Intelligent Operation and Maintenance (ICEIOM)
abstract: In the design and manufacture of turboshaft engines, numerous non-probabilistic uncertainties arise under data-scarce conditions, rendering classical probabilistic methods inadequate. This paper introduces Uncertainty Theory to establish a non-probabilistic analysis framework for key engine parameters. Focusing on high-pressure turbine tip clearance as a critical parameter, an evolutionary model of its uncertainty throughout manufacturing and service life is systematically developed, and the influence of clearance variations on performance is quantified in terms of belief degree. Results demonstrate that Uncertainty Theory effectively addresses tip-clearance variability: for example, the upper bound of efficiency loss at a 95 % belief degree is predicted more conservatively and comprehensively than by traditional probabilistic approaches. Furthermore, by optimizing the nominal tip clearance from 0.50 mm to 0.52 mm, the pass rate of performance requirements under high belief degree increases markedly from 78 % to 96 %, significantly enhancing design robustness. The proposed methodology provides a rigorous theoretical tool for non-probabilistic uncertainty analysis and reliability enhancement of turboshaft engines.

title: Multimodal Feature Fusion Framework for Tool Condition Monitoring
authors: Xing Shui, Rui Yuan, Yong Lv, Hongan Wu, Dengliang Zhu
publish: 2025 International Conference on Equipment Intelligent Operation and Maintenance (ICEIOM)
abstract: Data-driven tool condition monitoring (TCM) has gained increasing attention due to its high accuracy and adaptability in complex machining environments. Nevertheless, existing methods are often restricted to one-dimensional (1D) signal features or single-form image encodings, which leads to limited utilization, weak expression, and insufficient extraction of wear characteristics. To address these limitations, this paper proposes a multimodal image encoding strategy. Specifically, time series are transformed into RGB images via Recurrence Plots (RP), Short-Time Fourier Transform (STFT), and Gramian Angular Fields (GAF), thereby capturing time-frequency patterns, nonlinear dynamics, and trend information. The experimental results show that the method has high accuracy and versatility, and provides a practical solution for real-time TCM.

title: Application of a Noval Improved Marine Predator Algorithm in Resource Configuration for Formation Electronic Support
authors: Siyi Cheng, Dejiang Lu, Xi Zhang, Tianjian Yang, Yi Gan
publish: 2024 5th China International SAR Symposium (CISS)
abstract: A formation resource configuration framework based on heuristic intelligent learning is proposed to address the problem of fuzzy task planning for collaboratively jamming networked radar in complex electromagnetic environments. Firstly, a task capability matching rule is designed based on the target survival capability requirement index system to construct a reasonable resource configuration model for formation support operations. On this basis, a fast resource configuration method based on an improved Marine Predator Algorithm IMPA) is proposed to solve the model. The feasibility and superiority of the formation electronic support resource configuration method based on the IMPA are verified through simulation.

title: Advanced Motor Control Using Novel Control Techniques and Predictive Diagnostics for Electric Vehicles Using Machine Learning
authors: Ahmed Karim Galal, Ahmed Abdelkareem Sanad, Alaa Hussein Ali, Farida Mostafa Mohamed, Omnia Atef Elsayed, Merna Osama Talaat, Magdy Hamdy Mohamed, Radwa Mohamed Mostafa, S. A. Mohamed Shalaby, Rr Abdel-Wahab, Emad F. Yassin
publish: 2025 IEEE Conference on Power Electronics and Renewable Energy (CPERE)
abstract: This paper presents a real-time Field-Oriented Control (FOC) system for a PMSM used in electric vehicles, featuring a fuzzy logic speed controller and machine learning-based fault detection. Developed in MATLAB/Simulink and deployed on a TI C2000 microcontroller, the system includes Clarke/Park transformations, PI controllers, SVPWM, and Hall sensor feedback. A lightweight ML model monitors motor signals for early fault detection. Simulation and testing confirm accurate speed control and effective fault diagnosis, making the system a smart solution for EV applications.

title: Comprehensive Structure of IoT System for PV-powered Electric Bus Charging Station
authors: Ali Ashry, Alaa F. M. Ali, Alaaeldin M. Abdelshafy, Ahmed Elnozahy
publish: 2025 IEEE Conference on Power Electronics and Renewable Energy (CPERE)
abstract: Enhanced reliability, resiliency, adaptability, and energy efficiency are some of the advantages that IoT technology adds to any power system based on IoT technology. Consequently, the IoT technology plays a crucial role in IoT-based PV-powered charging station projects enabling real-time monitoring, performance tracking, and remote control as needed. In addition to providing monitoring and control functions, this paper describes the architecture of the IoT system built for this project and describes how active power generation limiting is carried out in accordance with actual load demands. Moreover, a scaled-down version of some parts of the station are hardware implemented and operated together for proof of concept that the system works properly. Also a data logger module, as interface between the weather conditions sensors and IoT web server in the weather station, is designed and implemented.

title: Joint Optimization Strategy for Electric Buses–Energy Storage Systems Considering Efficiency Models
authors: Yulu Li, Ziyu Guo, Senyong Fan, Yan Bao
publish: 2025 4th International Conference on Energy and Electrical Power Systems (ICEEPS)
abstract: With the advancement of fast-charging technology, many electric buses (EBs) connect to the grid for rapid charging during peak periods, posing challenges to the grid’s security and stability. At the same time, because charging is concentrated in daytime slots when electricity prices are higher, the charging costs of electric bus fast-charging stations (EBFCS) is substantially increased. This paper proposes a joint optimization strategy for electric buses–energy storage system (SESS) that accounts for both EB charging efficiency and SESS charge/discharge efficiency. This strategy exploits the "charging during valley hours and discharging during peak hours" characteristics of the SESS to reduce charging costs. The results show that the proposed method can reduce charging costs by 38.97% compared to the sequential charging strategy that only considers the charging efficiency of electric buses.

title: A Reinforcement Learning-Based Decentralized Control Strategy for Eco-Safe Mixed Platooning With CAVs and HDVs
authors: Xiangcheng Pan, Xiaofang Yuan, Zhigang Ling, Zhe Li, Kexin Liu, Yaonan Wang
publish: IEEE Transactions on Intelligent Transportation Systems
abstract: Mixed platoons, consisting of connected autonomous vehicles (CAVs) and human-driven vehicles (HDVs), are expected to dominate future roadways. However, achieving substantial improvements in fuel economy and safety under time-varying, mixed traffic conditions in real-world scenarios remains challenging. To this aim, this paper proposes a deep reinforcement learning (DRL) based decentralized control strategy, which consists of two levels: 1) At the methodology level, the hierarchical platoon formation algorithm systematically organizes the mixed platoons into local platoons with uniform car-following patterns and sub-platoons within a generic HDV-CAVs structure, enabling adaptation to time-varying traffic volume and mixed traffic heterogeneity. 2) At the operation level, the HDV-CAVs unit is embedded in the learning environment to capture uncertain HDV behaviors through state and reward propagation channels. Multiple objectives are explicitly integrated into the reward function. A safety-supervised decentralized proximal policy optimization algorithm is developed to enhance safety and training efficiency. Extensive validations demonstrate the effectiveness of the proposed strategy in improving fuel economy and safety under different traffic demand levels and penetration rates.

title: Table of Contents

publish: 2025 24th International Symposium on Communications and Information Technologies (ISCIT)
