The use of GFM inverters enables microgrids to operate independently of utility power and provide key advantages over synchronous generators in black start scenarios, including rapid startup and stable voltage and frequency support for critical loads. However, inverter-driven black start introduces unique challenges and operational considerations. This article examines key challenges and solutions, emphasizing inverter design, control strategies, and microgrid system requirements. Drawing on analysis, simulation, and experimental results, this article highlights the central role of GFM inverters in ensuring reliable and resilient microgrid operations.

title: On-Silicon Characterization of CDM-Like Stress in Long Interconnects Using vf-TLP in Nanometric ICs
authors: Mihaela-Daniela Dobre, Chyh-Yih Chang, Chi-Kuang Chen, Philippe Coll, Gheorghe Brezeanu
publish: IEEE Transactions on Device and Materials Reliability
abstract: This work presents a comprehensive silicon-based validation methodology for Charged Device Model Electrostatic Discharge (CDM-ESD) protection strategies in a 28 nm thin-oxide CMOS process. The approach evaluates multiple protection topologies such as duo/trio diodes, and grounded-gate nMOS (ggNMOS), using very-fast Transmission Line Pulse (vf-TLP) testing. Failure analysis (FA) via Scanning Electron Microscopy (SEM) is used to correlate electrical degradation with physical damage post-stress. In-depth analysis is performed from three key perspectives: the influence of averaging window selection on I–V curve fidelity, extraction and interpretation of decoupling capacitance and energy dissipation efficiency under CDM-like stress. Results highlight both the strengths and limitations of each protection method under fast transients, offering insight into optimal ESD design for long interconnect paths. Practical enhancements to the vf-TLP setup are also discussed. This study identifies layout-induced failure mechanisms too. The proposed framework enhances CDM robustness validation and informs future ESD strategies in scaled nodes.

title: Investigating Scale Independent UCT Exploration Factor Strategies_supp1-3634024.pdf
authors: Robin Schmocker
publish: N/A
abstract: The Upper Confidence Bounds For Trees (UCT) algorithm is not agnostic to the reward scale of the game it is applied to. For zero-sum games with the sparse rewards of <inline-formula xmlns:mml="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink"><tex-math notation="LaTeX">$\lbrace -1,0,1\rbrace$</tex-math></inline-formula> at the end of the game, this is not a problem, but many games often feature dense rewards with hand-picked reward scales, causing a node's Q-value to span different magnitudes across different games. In this paper, we evaluate various strategies for adaptively choosing the UCT exploration constant <inline-formula xmlns:mml="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink"><tex-math notation="LaTeX">$\lambda$</tex-math></inline-formula>, called <inline-formula xmlns:mml="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink"><tex-math notation="LaTeX">$\lambda$</tex-math></inline-formula>-strategies, that are agnostic to the game's reward scale. These <inline-formula xmlns:mml="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink"><tex-math notation="LaTeX">$\lambda$</tex-math></inline-formula>-strategies include those proposed in the literature as well as five new strategies. Given our experimental results, we recommend using one of our newly suggested <inline-formula xmlns:mml="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink"><tex-math notation="LaTeX">$\lambda$</tex-math></inline-formula>-strategies, which is to choose <inline-formula xmlns:mml="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink"><tex-math notation="LaTeX">$\lambda$</tex-math></inline-formula> as <inline-formula xmlns:mml="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink"><tex-math notation="LaTeX">$2 \cdot \sigma$</tex-math></inline-formula> where <inline-formula xmlns:mml="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink"><tex-math notation="LaTeX">$\sigma$</tex-math></inline-formula> is the empirical standard deviation of all state-action pairs' Q-values of the search tree. This method outperforms existing <inline-formula xmlns:mml="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink"><tex-math notation="LaTeX">$\lambda$</tex-math></inline-formula>-strategies across a wide range of tasks both in terms of a single parameter value and the peak performances obtained by optimizing all available parameters.

title: Review for "Strip-ViTAE: A Direction-Aware Transformer with Enhanced Feature Modeling for Remote Sensing Image Object Detection"
authors: N/A
publish: N/A

title: Personalized Lumbar Vertebrae Modeling for Dynamic Assessment of Idiopathic Scoliosis
authors: Chengyin Wang, Jianfeng Li, Shuo Wang, Yuxuan Wang, Jianguo Zhang, Mingjie Dong, Bin Fang, Qianyu Zhuang
publish: IEEE Journal of Biomedical and Health Informatics
abstract: Clinical assessment of idiopathic scoliosis (IS) patients primarily relies on static imaging techniques. Dynamic digital human (DDH) can provide comprehensive spatio-temporal information for dynamic assessment of the deformed spine in IS patients comparing with static imaging techniques, such as X-ray for general assessment and computed tomography (CT) for surgical planning. The lumbar vertebrae exhibit greater morphological variability than the thoracic region when subjected to different postures and mechanical loads, making them particularly important for dynamic assessment. Therefore, a personalized lumbar vertebrae model (PLVM) is proposed in this work to simulate lumbar vertebrae motion for IS patients; furthermore, an individualized DDH (i-DDH) is proposed by embedding PLVM into DDH to capture the spatio-temporal information. First, we use a bone primitive generation method to construct the DDH by incorporating Neural Radiance Fields (NeRF) and three-dimensional (3D) Gaussian splatting methods. Next, we develop the PLVM generation method to simulate lumbar vertebrae motion under different loads and postures. Finally, the bone primitives and PLVM are merged to generate the i-DDH for dynamic assessment. We validated i-DDH using multi-posture radiographs from eight IS patients awaiting surgery. The results demonstrate high accuracy compared to state-of-the-art (SOTA) models, with a mean angular error of <inline-formula xmlns:mml="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink"><tex-math notation="LaTeX">$0.96^\circ$</tex-math></inline-formula> and a maximum error of <inline-formula xmlns:mml="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink"><tex-math notation="LaTeX">$3.6^\circ$</tex-math></inline-formula> relative to radiographs. The proposed i-DDH framework is able to capture the spinal posture and conduct the dynamic assessment of IS patients rather than fixed positions. It overcomes the soft tissue artifact (STA) problem from motion capture systems and the failure to generate 3D spinal deformity of IS patients by training healthy subjects from computer vision methods. It also shows great clinical significance for preoperative planning and clinical assessment by providing dynamic spinal posture that cannot be achieved with static imaging.

title: Performance Analysis of Energy-Buffer Aided SWIPT in Extra-Large Massive MISO Systems
authors: ZiXuan Wu, Guofa Cai, Jiguang He
publish: IEEE Wireless Communications Letters
abstract: This paper investigates the performance of a nearfield multi-input single-output (MISO) simultaneous wireless information and power transfer (SWIPT) system with an energy buffer in multipath-dominated environments. The system comprises a base station equipped with a large-scale uniform planar array (UPA) and a single-antenna user equipment operating in the radiative near-field region, where signal propagation needs to be carried out through distributed scatterers due to the direct communication obstruction. By leveraging the Markov chain-based energy buffer model, we derived closed-form outage-probability expression of the proposed system, along with the asymptotic outage-probability expression under high transmit power regime. Theoretical and numerical results demonstrate that the proposed system significantly outperforms buffer-less counterpart. Moreover, increasing the number of scatterers enhances system reliability due to multipath diversity, while square UPA configurations exhibit superior performance over rectangular arrays due to improved projected aperture efficiency. Furthermore, it is revealed that an optimal power-splitting factor can minimize the outage probability. These findings provide foundational insights for designing energy-efficient near-field communications in multipath-dominated environments.

title: Unraveling the impact of peer government digital procurement on corporate digital innovation: insights from the AMC framework_supp1-3634144.docx
authors: Ge Ren
publish: N/A
abstract: In the rapidly evolving digital economy, governments are increasingly using public procurement policies to stimulate innovation among enterprises. However, the impact of peer government digital procurement (PGDP) on the digital innovation of focal firms remains underexplored, both theoretically and empirically. To address this gap, we apply the awareness-motivation-capability framework to investigate how PGDP influences focal firms digital innovation and its boundary conditions. We hypothesize that PGDP enhances firms awareness of digital innovation, motivating them to engage more actively in innovation efforts. This effect, we argue, depends on the firms' motivation and capability to respond to competitive pressures from peers. Specifically, industry competitive intensity and performance shortfall serve as key motivational factors, whereas ESG performance and innovation human resources are critical capability factors. Using data from Chinese listed firms between 2015 and 2023, we find strong empirical support for these hypotheses. After the robustness tests such as the instrumental variable method and system GMM, our conclusions remain unchanged. The heterogeneity analysis reveals that the PGDP has a more significant effect on digital innovation in nonSOEs. Overall, this study provides new theoretical and empirical insights, highlighting digital innovation as a key strategy for firms to respond effectively to PGDP, with important implications for high-quality development in the digital economy.

title: Co-opetition in the Ride-Hailing Market: The Role of the Integrated Channel in Balancing Supply and Demand_supp1-3634380.pdf
authors: Gang Li
publish: N/A
abstract: In the ride-hailing market, platforms such as Didi Chuxing are increasingly collaborating with taxi services through the integrated channel, like Simultaneous Ride-Hailing Request (SR). SR allows riders to submit a single request that includes both platform-based and taxi services, with the platform allocating each request to one of the two services and charging the corresponding price. To investigate the implications of SR, we develop an analytical model of a ride-hailing platform that integrates a platform-based service with self-scheduling drivers and a taxi service with fixed supply. Riders differ in their service preferences and sensitivity to driver availability. We find that although integrating the taxi service into the platform intensifies competition for riders between the two services, SR can yield a win-win outcome by improving both platform profitability and taxi utilization. In particular, SR enables the platform to serve additional riders without lowering the price and helps the taxi service alleviate demand loss caused by offline search frictions, thereby mitigating price competition across services. Moreover, we identify the sensitivity of self-scheduling drivers to rider availability as a key performance determinant driving these results. When self-scheduling drivers are sufficiently sensitive, SR adoption is profitable by enhancing supply–demand coordination. Finally, we confirm the robustness of our results by relaxing two key assumptions: allowing the platform to charge the commission fee on the taxi service and permitting platform-based riders to also use SR. Overall, this study provides new insights into platform–taxi cooperation and contributes to the broader understanding of sustainable ride-hailing markets.

title: Enabling Broadcasting-as-a-Service in Broadcast and Cellular Converged Networks
authors: Zihao Chen, Tao Lin, Yuting Gao, Yu Zhang, Yin Xu, Dazhi He, Jinyao Yan, Yahui Hu
publish: IEEE Transactions on Broadcasting
abstract: Broadcast and cellular converged networks (BCCNs) provide a promising solution to alleviate network congestion and improve user experience in environments such as massive-scale live streaming. However, existing studies on BCCNs mainly use a network-centric design paradigm where broadcast offloading is seen as just a network optimization tool, ignoring the interests of internet applications. As a result, this greatly limits their full potential. In this paper, we propose a novel Broadcast-as-a-Service framework for BCCNs, enabling broadcast network operators to provide dynamic on-demand broadcasting services to both internet applications and cellular network operators. Specifically, our proposed framework extends beyond traditional network-initiated offloading by allowing content providers to request broadcast offloading based on application-specific requirements. Furthermore, to enable dynamic on-demand broadcasting, we design a comprehensive metric to represent offloading benefits and formulate the offloading decision problem as an Integer Linear Programming (ILP), taking multi-stakeholder interests into account, including broadcast operators, cellular networks, and content providers. Last, we develop a Lyapunov-guided online offloading (LGO) algorithm to maximize offloading benefits while ensuring the long-term service violation rate does not exceed a predefined limit, avoiding frequent offloading switches. Extensive experiments validate that our proposed method outperforms all baselines in offloading utility while reducing the service violation rate by more than 10X compared to the best-performing baseline algorithm.

title: Three-dimensional Ultrasonic Imaging of CFRP Laminates Using Anisotropic Volumetric Total Focusing Method
authors: Zhenyang Yu, Shiwei Wu, Huan Wang, Shuyi Wang, Jian Chen, Hua-Xin Peng
publish: IEEE Transactions on Instrumentation and Measurement
abstract: The layered configuration and strong anisotropy of carbon fiber-reinforced polymer (CFRP) laminates pose critical challenges on accurate imaging of internal defects. Three-dimensional (3D) imaging is desirable for comprehensive evaluation, but it is traditionally formed by stitching a series of two-dimensional (2D) images, which is complicated and time-consuming. Here, an anisotropic volumetric total focusing method (AV-TFM) for CFRP laminates by using a 2D phased array was proposed. Firstly, the elastic constants were derived from the full matrix data. Then, the simplified QP-wave group velocity formula was derived to directly correlate the velocity and its angle. Therefore, the group velocities at any angle can be simply calculated. Finally, the anisotropic effect was corrected for 3D imaging by total focusing method efficiently and precisely. Simulations and experiments were conducted on different CFRP laminates with internal defects to verify the effectiveness of AV-TFM. Results prove that AV-TFM enables accurate volumetric imaging of anisotropic CFRP laminates, providing a simple and comprehensive avenue for non-destructive evaluation of large CFRP components during manufacturing and in service.

title: Multi-Agent Deep Reinforcement Learning for Safe Autonomous Driving With RICS-Assisted MEC
authors: Xueyao Zhang, Bo Yang, Xuelin Cao, Zhiwen Yu, George C. Alexandropoulos, Yan Zhang, Mérouane Debbah, Chau Yuen
publish: IEEE Transactions on Intelligent Transportation Systems
abstract: Environment sensing and fusion via onboard sensors are envisioned to be widely applied in future autonomous driving networks. This paper considers a vehicular system with multiple self-driving vehicles that is assisted by multi-access edge computing (MEC), where image data collected by the sensors is offloaded from cellular vehicles to the MEC server using vehicle-to-infrastructure (V2I) links. Sensory data can also be shared among surrounding vehicles via vehicle-to-vehicle (V2V) communication links. To improve spectrum utilization, the V2V links may reuse the same frequency spectrum as the V2I links, which may cause severe interference. To tackle this issue, we leverage reconfigurable intelligent computational surfaces (RICSs) to jointly enable V2I reflective links and mitigate interference appearing at the V2V links. Considering the limitations of traditional algorithms in addressing this problem, such as the assumption of quasi-static channel state information, which restricts their ability to adapt to dynamic environmental changes and leads to poor performance under frequently varying channel conditions, in this paper, we formulate the problem at hand as a Markov game. Our novel formulation is applied to time-varying channels subject to multi-user interference and introduces a collaborative learning mechanism among users. The considered optimization problem is solved via a driving safety-enabled multi-agent deep reinforcement learning (DS-MADRL) approach that capitalizes on the RICS presence. Our extensive numerical investigations showcase that the proposed reinforcement learning approach achieves faster convergence and significant enhancements in both data rate and driving safety, as compared to various state-of-the-art benchmarks.

title: Modeling glenohumeral stability in musculoskeletal simulations: A validation study with in vivo contact forces
authors: Ibrahim Mohammed I. Hasan, Italo Belli, Ajay Seth, Elena M. Gutierrez-Farewik
publish: IEEE Transactions on Neural Systems and Rehabilitation Engineering
abstract: Common optimization approaches for solving the muscle redundancy problem in musculoskeletal simulations can predict shoulder contact forces that either violate or barely satisfy joint stability requirements, with force directions falling outside or near the perimeter of the glenoid cavity. In this study, several glenohumeral stability formulations were tested against in vivo measurements of glenohumeral contact forces from the Orthoload dataset on one participant data in lateral, posterior, and anterior dumbbell raises. The investigated formulations either constrained the contact force direction to remain within different shapes of a stability perimeter, or added a penalty term that discouraged contact force directions from deviating from the glenoid cavity center. All stability formulations predicted contact force magnitudes that agreed relatively well to the in vivo measured forces except for the strictest formulation that constrained the joint contact force directly to the glenoid cavity center. Constraint and conditional penalty models estimated force vectors that largely lay along the perimeters. Continuous penalty models estimated relatively more accurate contact force directions within the glenoid cavity than constraint models. Our findings support the proposed penalty formulations as more reasonable and accurate than other investigated existing glenohumeral stability formulations.

title: SR-Planner: Sampling-Based Path Planning with Feasibility-Aware Focus Regions and Robust Trajectory Optimization for Mobile Manipulator
authors: Shuhang Wang, Le Zheng, Yiming Zeng, Hui Cheng
publish: IEEE Robotics and Automation Letters
abstract: High-quality motion planning for mobile manipulators remains a challenging task due to the high dimensionality and complex constraints involved. While existing methods perform well in specific scenarios, their efficiency and the quality of the resulting paths and trajectories often degrade in dense or irregular environments. In this paper, we propose a unified motion planning framework for mobile manipulators. It consists of two parts: a sampling-based path planner with feasibility-aware focus regions for efficient path generation, and a WA-QN optimizer that adaptively filters and aggregates curvature information to enhance convergence in high-dimensional spaces. Comprehensive experiments in simulated and real-world scenarios demonstrate that our method achieves faster planning, higher success rates, and superior path and trajectory quality, while exhibiting strong generalization across diverse environments.

title: High-Performance Control Strategy for Robot Servo System with Flexible Joint via Output Regulation Model Predictive Control
authors: Likai Zheng, Jinhao Liu, Shihua Li, Yixiao Ding, Quanxue Guan, Xiaohong Wang
publish: IEEE Transactions on Power Electronics
abstract: To address the challenges of vibration suppression, reference tracking, constraint satisfaction, and disturbance rejection in robot servo systems with flexible joints, this paper presents a novel model predictive control (MPC) framework that integrates output regulation theory and disturbance observer (DO) techniques. First, multi-source disturbances in permanent magnet synchronous motor (PMSM)-driven robot servo systems-including torsional torque, multi-frequency torque ripple, and parameter uncertainties-are uniformly modeled via output regulation theory as an exosystem. Then, the multi-source disturbances are estimated using a reduced-order DO. Based on these estimations and output regulation theory, a transformed dynamic model is developed that inherently embeds the optimal reference trajectory, eliminating the need for separate trajectory optimization. Furthermore, the tracking problem of the original disturbed system is reformulated as a stabilization problem for the transformed system, which is then addressed by the proposed output regulation MPC (ORMPC) scheme that explicitly incorporates state and control input constraints. Finally, experimental results on a PMSM-driven robot servo system coupled via a spring demonstrate the effectiveness of the proposed MPC framework.

title: Evaluating Super-Resolution Effects on Generative Design Images: A User-Centered Study in Sneaker Visualization
authors: Hui-Jun Kim, Sung-Hee Kim
publish: IEEE Access
abstract: Generative AI models such as Stable Diffusion are increasingly used to support creative ideation, but their low-resolution outputs limit practical use in design workflows. This study addresses this gap by comparing three super-resolution (SR) models Flux, SUPIR, and Ultimate SD on sneaker-specific generative images, focusing on user-centered perceptual outcomes rather than only PSNR/SSIM metrics. A within-subject user study (N=17) was conducted with images upscaled from 512×512 to 1024×1024 pixels, followed by post-experiment interviews. SUPIR achieved the lowest perceived change counts (M=1.06 vs. Ultimate M=5.12, p<.01) and reduced perceived change ratios by up to 68% relative to Ultimate. In subjective ratings, SUPIR scored highest for efficiency (M=5.94) and shape consistency (M=6.29), significantly outperforming Flux and Ultimate (p<.01). Interview participants frequently described SUPIR as “best preserving the original design,” while Ultimate was criticized for “introducing unnecessary visual changes.” These results highlight a misalignment between conventional metrics and user perception and emphasize the need for perceptual and workflow-aware evaluation. By combining quantitative and qualitative findings, this study provides actionable insights for selecting SR models that preserve design intent and improve designer satisfaction in AI-assisted design workflows.

title: MCFINet: A Cost-Efficient Multi-Channel Feature Integration Network for Surface Scenarios Image Super-Resolution
authors: Liangcheng Zhao, Yueying Wang, Yuhao Qing, Dan Zeng, Li Xu
publish: ACM Transactions on Multimedia Computing, Communications, and Applications
abstract: Convolutional Neural Network (CNN) and vision Transformer (ViT) have revolutionized the field of image super - resolution (SR). However, their complexity poses challenges for resource - constrained scenarios, particularly due to the high computational demands of Transformers and their excessive reliance on global information. To tackle these challenges, we propose a Multi - channel Feature Integration Network (MCFINet), designed to maximize input pixel utilization while minimizing computational overhead. It integrates both local and global features within the channels, thereby exploiting their complementary advantages. First, the designed Feature Integration Block (FIB) effectively captures local information and improves visual quality by enhancing the mapping of non - local features. Subsequently, we utilize the Adaptive Channel Fusion Block (ACFB), which strengthens the interaction between features and channels while maintaining computational efficiency. Finally, for SR task on resource-constrained surface scenarios, we propose a more suitable pre-training method, which further boosts the model’s learning ability. Evaluation results indicate that the proposed MCFINet achieves a better balance between lightweight design and high-quality restoration on both standard evaluation datasets and water surface target datasets. Specifically, compared to the traditional SwinIR-L, MCFINet reduces model training time and runtime by 12% on the test set, while also decreasing model complexity by 43%. Our codes are available at https://github.com/Lcasjz/MCFINet.

title: Biometric Gait Recognition Using BlazePose and Deep Learning
authors: Baginda Mi'raj Williamsyah, Achmad Rizal, Tito Waluyo Purboyo, Laily Ade Oktaviana, Alfridsyah, Amira J. Zaylaa
publish: 2025 12th International Conference on Information Technology, Computer, and Electrical Engineering (ICITACEE)
abstract: Biometric identification based on human gait provides a non-intrusive and practical alternative to conventional methods that rely on wearable sensors or markerbased systems. Despite the increasing interest in marker less approaches, existing studies often utilize limited datasets, are captured from a single viewpoint, and struggle to distinguish individuals with similar walking styles or physical characteristics. This study introduces a gait-based identification pipeline that utilizes normal walking video data from 17 participants with diverse anthropometric profiles. The system applies Blaze Pose to extract 33 key points from frontal and lateral views, from which 35 features are engineered to represent anthropometric, kinematic, and statistical aspects of gait. These features are then classified using various machine learning models to evaluate performance. The multilayer perceptron (MLP) achieved the best results, with a recognition accuracy of 97.06 % and a low false acceptance rate (FAR) of 0.1838 %. Compared to prior methods that often focus on constrained data with minimal viewpoint variation, the proposed system demonstrates improved generalizability and robustness when recognizing individuals with similar gait patterns. The use of both anthropometric and dynamic features from multi-angle video further enhances its discriminatory power. Overall, the proposed approach proves to be a reliable and efficient solution for gait-based biometric identification, suitable for real-world applications such as intelligent surveillance and user authentication. It also lays a solid foundation for future studies in more complex or unconstrained environments.

title: Three-Dimensional Reconstruction Algorithm of Medical Images Based on Image Signal Processing Technology and Its Application in Surgical Navigation
authors: Shuo Zhang
publish: 2025 19th International Conference on Complex Medical Engineering (CME)
abstract: To understand the recent development status of three-dimensional (3D) reconstruction algorithms for medical images based on image signal processing technology and their application in surgical navigation, this paper employs VOSviewer and CiteSpace for quantitative analysis and visualization of relevant literature from the Web of Science (WoS) database spanning 2014 to 2025. It introduces the research hotspots, evolutionary paths, and development trends in this field. Highly cited and representative literature from different periods are deeply interpreted and analyzed to summarize mainstream research hotspots and grasp the developmental pulse. The findings reveal: (1) Diverse research directions among authors in this field; (2) Chinese universities are the primary publishing institutions and attach significant importance to it; (3) Over the past decade, the rapid expansion in the depth and breadth of research in this field has made its application in the medical field more efficient and intelligent.

title: Blood Glucose Estimation Method Based on Data from Optical Sensors Using Machine Learning
authors: Kazuki Asakura, Saki Takaira, Hiroki Matsumoto
publish: 2025 24th International Symposium on Communications and Information Technologies (ISCIT)
abstract: In recent years, as the number of individuals suspected of having diabetes continues to rise, the need for continuous monitoring of blood glucose levels has become more significant. However, commonly used household blood glucose testing methods are invasive, which not only creates physical and emotional burdens for users but also increases the risk of infections. As a result, the development of safe and non-invasive glucose monitoring devices is highly desired. A technique for non-destructive and non-invasive measurement of sugar content in fruits using optical sensors has already been established. By focusing on the near-infrared spectroscopy employed in this technique, the objective is to construct a non-invasive method for measuring blood glucose levels. This paper explores a method for estimating glucose concentration by combining near-infrared spectroscopy using an optical sensor and machine learning. First, a prediction model for glucose concentration is developed using a multilayer perceptron (MLP) trained with absorbance data covering the entire wavelength range from 680 to 2500 nm, obtained via near-infrared spectroscopy, which is considered safe for the human body. Then, for practical use, Grad-CAM (Gradient-weighted Class Activation Mapping) is applied to identify the wavelength regions emphasized by the model during prediction. Finally, this paper examines a method to estimate glucose concentration by using an MLP model trained only on absorbance data from selected wavelengths. Prediction accuracy is evaluated using MAPE (Mean Absolute Percentage Error), with a target of 0.1% or less to distinguish between pre- and postprandial glucose levels. As a result, the model trained with all wavelengths achieves a MAPE of 0.0593%. Models using eight and seven selected wavelengths achieve MAPE values of 0.0773% and 0.0658%, respectively, both meeting the target threshold. Moreover, even with only four to six wavelengths, glucose estimation remains possible with a MAPE below 0.2%.

title: Fractional Doppler Impact on OMP Based Multiuser OTFS Channel Estimation
authors: Dimitar Tanevski, Venceslav Kafedziski
publish: 2025 17th International Conference on Advanced Technologies, Systems and Services in Telecommunications (TELSIKS)
abstract: We analyze the performance degradation due to fractional Doppler shifts in multiuser uplink OTFS, when the OTFS channel estimation is performed with OMP algorithm. For the actual channel we use input output expressions in DopplerDelay (DD) domain, where fractional Doppler shifts and delays are introduced. For estimation we use channel model in DD domain with delays and Doppler shifts on the grid to generate the OMP sensing matrix. The channel estimation does not account for the fractional Doppler shifts and delays, i.e. uses integer Doppler shifts and delays. To evaluate the algorithm performance for different fractional Doppler shifts we use the estimation Mean Square Error and the detection symbol error rate. The purpose is to ascertain the appropriate circumstances for OMP’s application without significant performance loss. To improve channel estimation performance, we also use refined DD domain grid for OMP estimation i.e. larger dictionary of the sensing matrix.

title: Capacity planning of integrated energy system in agricultural park based on greenhouse thermal inertia and load flexibility
authors: Jindong Liu, Peng Zhang, Yingshun Liu, Yang Gao, Zijun Liang, Haitao Li, Mengchao Liu
publish: 2025 4th International Conference on Energy and Electrical Power Systems (ICEEPS)
abstract: In the context of the dual carbon goals and the pursuit of high-quality development, the role of agriculture in these processes is of paramount importance. It is evident that the agricultural park constitutes a pivotal component within the overarching framework of agricultural modernization. To illustrate this, a contemporary agricultural park in the northern region has been selected for analysis. The study examines the virtual energy storage characteristics of the greenhouse within the park and the flexibility of its production load. It establishes an optimal configuration model for the integrated energy system in the park and solves the optimal configuration scheme of the integrated energy system in the modern agricultural park, considering the virtual energy storage characteristics of the greenhouse. The efficacy of the model is demonstrated by comparing it with a scheme that does not consider the characteristics of greenhouse virtual energy storage and the production of flexible load.

title: Affective Disorder Recognition via Smartphone Sensing: A Non-Intrusive Approach on Campus
authors: Guanbo Feng, Gang Cheng, Yichen Bai, Yuqing Lin, Sihan Li, Gang Cheng, Minqiang Yang
publish: 2025 19th International Conference on Complex Medical Engineering (CME)
abstract: Early detection of major depressive disorder (MDD) remains challenging due to limitations of self-report assessments. This study proposes a non-intrusive framework for depression recognition using passively collected smartphone sensor data and multivariate time series modeling. Behavioral data from 56 university students over $\mathbf{1 4}$ days were collected via a custom app, MoodSense, covering physical activity, mobility, social interaction, and environmental cues. A total of 603 daily sequences were labeled using PHQ-9 scores. After comprehensive feature engineering and alignment, we benchmarked state-of-the-art time series models across four architectures: RNNs, CNNs, Transformers, and ROCKET. Among them, MultiROCKET achieved the best overall performance, reaching 73.3% accuracy and macro F1-score of 70.3%, while maintaining high computational efficiency. Ablation studies confirmed movement and social features as the most predictive behavioral markers. Spatial-temporal visualization revealed depressive patterns such as reduced mobility and social withdrawal. This work demonstrates the feasibility of unobtrusive, real-world emotion recognition via smartphone sensing, offering practical value for early mental health screening and affective behavior modeling.

title: Knowledge-Enhanced DLM-DTI: Improving Drug-Target Interaction Prediction with Biological Knowledge Integration
authors: Yunjia Li
publish: 2025 19th International Conference on Complex Medical Engineering (CME)
abstract: Deep language model-based DTI predictors often lack integration of biological knowledge, resulting in limited interpretability. This work introduces a knowledge-enhanced DLM-DTI framework that incorporates KEGG pathways and Gene Ontology annotations into transformer-based molecular and protein representations. Benchmark results show $\mathbf{7 - 9 \%}$ higher AUC-ROC and $9-11 \%$ higher AUPR compared to leading baselines. Case studies in oncology and cardiovascular diseases achieve AUC-ROC scores of 0.945 and 0.923, respectively, with attention weights revealing biologically meaningful pathways. The framework maintains efficiency with 0.02-second inference per pair, enabling practical application to large-scale virtual screening.

title: Prediction of EV Charging Stations Congestion using XGBoost Approach
authors: Jelena D. Velimirović, Lazar Z. Velimirović, Zoran P. Stajić
publish: 2025 17th International Conference on Advanced Technologies, Systems and Services in Telecommunications (TELSIKS)
abstract: This paper presents a data-driven approach for predicting congestion at electric vehicle charging stations using XGBoost. By combining real-world usage data with synthetically generated sessions and modeling personalized, time-based usage patterns, our method improves accuracy and interpretability. Cross-validation and residual analysis confirm strong performance comparing to similar models. This approach led to useful predictions that are practical and user-centered, and extends the possibilities for forecasting within emerging forms of mobility and energy systems.

title: Adaptive Fault Size Estimation of Rolling Element Bearing Outer Race under Low-Speed and Variable-Speed Conditions
authors: Chen Xin, Wang Yong, Yong Long, Yu Guo, Feixiang Zhang, Zisheng Ma
publish: 2025 International Conference on Equipment Intelligent Operation and Maintenance (ICEIOM)
abstract: To address the issue of the difficulty in adaptively estimating the fault size of rolling element bearings (REBs) under low-speed and variable-speed conditions, an instantaneous angular speed (IAS)-based REB fault size adaptive estimation method, which combined the savitzky-golay (SG) filter and median absolute deviation (MAD) is proposed. Firstly, the IAS fluctuation characteristics caused by REB outer race faults under different speeds and radial loads conditions are studied. Secondly, the effectiveness characteristics of the SG filter under different parameter conditions are analyzed, and an adaptive scheme for determining the optimal parameters of the SG filter is proposed to eliminate the speed component. Finally, the fault size of the REB outer race under low-speed and variable-speed conditions is adaptively estimated based on the adaptive SG filter and the adaptive MAD threshold. Experimental data picked under different outer race fault sizes, speeds, and radial load conditions are used to verify the effectiveness and robustness of the proposed method.

title: Discussion on the Application of Mobile Energy Storage Technology in Distribution Networks
authors: Jiajin Lin, Jian Sun, Yijian Li, Xuntao Shi, Zhizhao Ou, Xiaobing Xiao, Tianwen Kong
publish: 2025 4th International Conference on Energy and Electrical Power Systems (ICEEPS)
abstract: With the transformation of urban energy systems towards flexible and highly resilient structures, energy storage systems with mobility and rapid response capabilities are becoming an important force supporting the new distribution pattern. Compared with fixed energy storage, mobile systems offer modularity and rapid deployment, making them especially valuable in sudden outages, peak regulation, and scheduled maintenance. Centering on this emerging technological path, the entire chain from system architecture, scenario adaptation to scheduling modeling is systematically examined. The focus is on revealing the controllable channel between the physical system and the operation strategy of mobile energy storage, and exploring how it can complete the full-process deployment from supply intervention to response closed loop with path optimization as the core logic.

title: Analysis of Leakage Current in Various Environments with Alternating Shed Polymer Insulators at High Voltage
authors: Ikhsan Arif Purwoko, Abdul Syakur, Susatyo Handoko
publish: 2025 12th International Conference on Information Technology, Computer, and Electrical Engineering (ICITACEE)
abstract: The performance of polymer insulators in high-voltage distribution systems is significantly influenced by environmental conditions, which can lead to increased leakage current and insulation degradation. This paper presents an experimental investigation on alternating shed-type polymer insulators subjected to high voltage under various surface contaminations, including dust and water, as well as controlled humidity and temperature. Measurements were conducted in a high-voltage laboratory environment, incorporating leakage current monitoring, THD (total harmonic distortion) analysis, and contact angle evaluation. The study also examines the effectiveness of silicone oil coating as a surface treatment to enhance hydrophobicity and suppress leakage current. Post-coating results revealed a reduction or stabilization of leakage current across all tested conditions, with the water-contaminated case decreasing from 0.048 mA to 0.044 mA. THD values also slightly improved, accompanied by an increase in average contact angle from 70.5° to 81.5°, indicating enhanced surface hydrophobicity. These improvements limit moisture film formation and conductive paths on the insulator surface. Additionally, the alternating shed geometry demonstrated superior resistance to surface tracking and arcing under polluted environments. This study provides comprehensive insight into the combined impact of geometry and hydrophobic coating on the electrical performance of polymer insulators and offers practical recommendations for improving their reliability in harsh outdoor applications.

title: Research on Carbon Emission Accounting of Power Transmission and Transformation Projects Based on Life Cycle Approach
authors: Fan Yang, Xiaohui Wang, Yue Tang, Shili Liu, Jianqing Li, Si Shen
publish: 2025 4th International Conference on Energy and Electrical Power Systems (ICEEPS)
abstract: This paper systematically studies the carbon emission accounting of power transmission and transformation projects based on the life cycle theory. Through a literature review, it summarizes the latest achievements in the accounting methods of life cycle carbon emissions of substation buildings, key links and decarbonization strategies for carbon emissions in power transmission and transformation projects, and influencing factors and optimization design of carbon emissions. Taking a 220kV power transmission and transformation project in Anhui Province as a case study, it analyzes the carbon emission characteristics of the project in four stages: building materials production and transportation, construction, operation and maintenance, and demolition and recycling. It also uses a "bottom-up" model to account for the life cycle carbon emissions of the project. The study finds that the building materials production and transportation stage and the operation and maintenance stage are the key links of carbon emissions in the power transmission and transformation project, accounting for 34.7% and 64.1%, respectively. Based on this, the paper proposes decarbonization paths such as optimizing the selection of building materials, improving equipment energy efficiency and energy-saving transformation, establishing intelligent operation and maintenance systems, and using low-carbon demolition technologies. These measures aim to achieve the carbon reduction goals of the entire life cycle of power transmission and transformation projects and provide scientific support for the power industry to contribute to the "dual carbon" goals.

title: Autonomous Robots and Educational motivation: The impact of combining educational robotics with simulations on learners' Technical and scientific skills
authors: Hommane Boudine, Meriem Bebtaleb, Abderrahim Tayebi, Mohamed Tayebi
publish: 2025 11th International Conference on Optimization and Applications (ICOA)
abstract: Teaching and indoctrinating technological and scientific concepts face several obstacles in scientific and technical subjects, negatively impacting students' academic performance. To address these challenges and enhance the understanding of technological concepts, Morocco's Ministry of Education has launched a new industrial technology program that encourages the use of robots as teaching aids to improve educational efficiency and learning outcomes. This study aimed to evaluate the effects of combining educational robotics with computer-assisted simulations on the motivation and learning of industrial technology students. We divided 168 secondary school students into two groups: one used a model combining educational robot manipulation with simulation, while the other used traditional simulations. The results indicate that integrating educational robots significantly improves overall academic performance, especially in teaching complex technological concepts. This study provides valuable insights for improving teaching practices and supports the integration of educational robotics into science education in Morocco.

title: Temperature Rise Prediction of Multi-Disc Clutch during Sliding Process
authors: Yan Ye, Cenbo Xiong, Biao Ma, Changsong Zheng, Fujun Zhang
publish: 2025 International Conference on Equipment Intelligent Operation and Maintenance (ICEIOM)
abstract: The temperature rise prediction of the friction components in multi-disc clutches is of great significance for ensuring the stable operation of the transmission system. A hybrid prediction method for clutch temperature rise based on trend decomposition is proposed. The period term and trend term in the data are decomposed by using the exponential moving average decomposition and the RevIN method to reconstruct the distribution of the input data. Feature extraction is carried out with the aid of the CNN to enhance the feature learning ability of the model. The Multi-Layer Perception (MLP) model and the Crossformer model are adopted to predict the trend and period terms respectively. The final prediction result is obtained by synthesizing the two parts of the output. By comparing with three representative models, it is verified that this method has a relatively high prediction accuracy, and the average performance is improved by at least 23.5%.

title: Martingale transforms in vector lattices
authors: Tarik Boukara, Driss Gretete, Kawtar Ramdane
publish: 2025 11th International Conference on Optimization and Applications (ICOA)
abstract: In this work, we extend our previous study [6] on martingale transforms in vector lattices by generalising the concept to include sub-sup transforms within this broader framework. We investigate refined conditions that ensure the order convergence of these transforms, viewed as a natural analogue of almost sure convergence in classical probability theory. Furthermore, we provide a concrete example illustrating the construction and properties of these transforms in the vector lattice setting.

title: AI-DPWS: A Pilot Study based on Acoustic-Impedance Dual-Modal Pharyngeal Wearable System for IDDSI-Based Swallowing Function Assessment
authors: Jun Long, Yacen Wu, Pingbo Chen, Fu Zhang
publish: 2025 19th International Conference on Complex Medical Engineering (CME)
abstract: Wearable systems hold great promise for the early screening of dysphagia. However, existing studies have largely focused on the recognition and classification of specific food types, lacking objective quantitative research based on the International Dysphagia Diet Standardisation Initiative (IDDSI). In this paper, we present an acoustic-impedance dual modal pharyngeal wearable system (AI-DPWS) for synchronous acquisition and quantitative analysis of swallowing impedance and acoustic signals from the aged subjects on taking eight viscosity levels of food defined by IDDSI. First, the implementation of AI-DPWS is described. Next, dual modal signals are collected from 30 aged participants in the IDDSI protocol, and four kinetics metrics are extracted, that is two acoustic features (swallowing sound duration (SSD), half-energy duration (HED)) and two impedance features (pharyngeal phase duration (PPD) and pharyngeal impedance variations (PIV)). Finally, statistical methods are applied to compare and analyze swallowing characteristic differences at different IDDSI levels. The results show that SSD and PPD are lengthened by 0.54 s and 0.38 s, respectively in IDDSI levels from 0 to 7. Similarly, HED rises from $0.29 \pm 0.04 \mathrm{~s}$ to $0.52 \pm 0.17 \mathrm{~s}$, and PIV increases from $50 \pm 8 \mathrm{mV}$ to $71 \pm 14 \mathrm{mV}$ with the increase of the IDDSI levels. Moreover, PIV and PPD exhibit a strong positive correlation ($\mathbf{r} \boldsymbol{=} \mathbf{0. 9 9 2}$), and mean adjacent-level Cohen’s d ranges from 0.5 to 1.0. These results demonstrate that the dual-modal measurement signals effectively achieve complementarity in monitoring swallowing process, and exhibit richer feature information for discriminating different IDDSI levels. This study provides a novel approach for swallowing function assessment based on the IDDSI framework and could offer experimental evidence for further research on the age-related dysphagia.

title: Application Evaluation for GNSS Coincide Frequency Interference Avoidance of LUTAN-1
authors: Junjian Wen, Chuheng Tang, Ruifeng LU, Ruwei Zhang, Xingbin Ye, Zhaoyu Zhong, Chun Wei
publish: 2024 5th China International SAR Symposium (CISS)
abstract: The operating band of SAR installed on the LuTan-l satellite overlaps with the L2 and B31 bands of GNSS receiver, resulting in coincide frequency interference. To reduce electromagnetic interference, a microwave switch is designed inside the GNSS receiver to synchronously turn off the microwave switch during SAR pulse transmission. After the satellite was launched, the GNSS measurement data of the satellite in orbit was analyzed, and the evaluation results showed that the coincide frequency interference avoidance measures taken by the satellite were effective.

title: Edge computing-driven remote health management real-time monitoring system
authors: Lu Yu
publish: 2025 19th International Conference on Complex Medical Engineering (CME)
abstract: This paper designs a remote health management realtime monitoring system based on edge computing, aiming to solve the problems of poor real-time performance and high bandwidth consumption in traditional remote health monitoring systems. The system adopts a three-layer architecture, including the perception layer, edge layer and cloud layer. Each layer works together to realize the real-time collection, processing and management of user physiological parameters. In order to improve the model training efficiency and prediction accuracy of the system, an original adaptive weighted federated edge learning algorithm (AWFEL) is proposed. The algorithm dynamically evaluates the data quality and computing power of edge nodes, assigns adaptive weights to nodes, and combines local differential privacy technology to protect user privacy. Experimental simulation results show that compared with the traditional federated learning algorithm, the prediction accuracy of the AWFEL algorithm is improved by an average of 8.3%, and the training time is shortened by an average of 21.7%; compared with the centralized learning algorithm, the data transmission volume is reduced by an average of 68.5%, and the system response delay is reduced by an average of 75%, which is only 120 ms. At the same time, the data leakage probability of the system is less than 0.1%, and the privacy protection level is $\mathbf{1. 2}$ times that of the industry standard. The system and algorithm can meet the needs of real-time monitoring of remote health management and have high practical value.

title: CDL Channel Simulation in Jakarta City Using Reflection Order Parameters, Antenna Height, and Direction Angles
authors: Wahyu Pamungkas, Anggun Fitrian Isnawati, Fathir Adli Ahmad Arrifqi, Zulfikar Al Hakim, Rina Amaelia, Alivia Laily Alawiyah
publish: 2025 12th International Conference on Information Technology, Computer, and Electrical Engineering (ICITACEE)
abstract: Urban wireless communication systems face significant challenges due to dense building structures that cause complex multipath propagation, resulting in signal degradation. This study addresses the need for a realistic channel modelling approach by analyzing the performance of the Clustered Delay Line (CDL) channel in Jakarta's urban environment. The research employs ray-tracing simulations to evaluate the effects of varying transmitter antenna height, elevation angle, and reflection order on signal propagation characteristics. Using a fixed elevation angle of <tex xmlns:mml="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">$45^{\circ}$</tex> and reflection order of 5, simulations were conducted for two antenna heights: 4 meters and 10 meters. The results indicate that increasing the antenna height from 4 m to 10 m reduced the number of significant multipath reflections and improved signal quality. Path loss values ranged from 65 dB to 160 dB at 4 m, with more severe signal degradation, while the 10 m configuration showed fewer zones exceeding 130 dB. Furthermore, the instantaneous channel gain improved by approximately <tex xmlns:mml="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">$6-10 ~\text{dB}$</tex> on average when using the higher antenna position, and magnitude-squared responses across OFDM symbols and subcarriers showed reduced fading intensity. These findings demonstrate that transmitter height has a critical impact on urban channel characteristics and highlight the importance of spatial parameters in the optimization of wireless system deployment, particularly for 5G networks.

title: Design of Military Logistics Supply Chain Platform Based on Blockchain
authors: Jin Pang, Guowei Chen, Juqin Fan, Zhiyi Du
publish: 2025 International Conference on Equipment Intelligent Operation and Maintenance (ICEIOM)
abstract: In the context of the continuous improvement of the modern asset management system, in view of the difficulties in breaking through the traditional logistics support concept, integrating the supply chain, and the lack of joint support force of the integrated national strategic force, this paper establishes a logistics support supply chain model by using blockchain technology. On this basis, a deeply integrated supply chain information platform is established in combination with blockchain technology, which effectively connects the basic functions such as transportation, storage, loading, handling, packaging, processing and distribution, as well as all relevant parties involved, weakening the information gap. Compared with the traditional form of logistics support concept, the military logistics support supply chain (the MLSSC) platform can improve the security of data information while eliminating the information gap through mechanisms such as timely data uploading, traceability, tamper-proof, and channel isolation. Through case analysis, the feasibility and effectiveness of the MLSSC platform based on blockchain in practical application are verified.

title: Numerical Simulation of Multi-stage reciprocating Compressor Integration in Compressed Air Station
authors: Liangxiang Liu, Le Wang, Shaoxing Yu, Xiaoming Liu, Yi Tang
publish: 2025 4th International Conference on Energy and Electrical Power Systems (ICEEPS)
abstract: This study presents a comprehensive numerical simulation framework for multi-stage reciprocating compressors integrated into compressed air stations. Reciprocating compressors are widely utilized in industrial applications due to their high-pressure delivery and operational flexibility. However, their complex internal flow dynamics, transient valve behavior, and thermal interactions pose significant challenges for performance prediction and optimization. The proposed framework integrates a one-dimensional (1D) model based on the conservation laws of mass, momentum, and energy to simulate the entire compressed air station. This includes detailed sub-models for key components: the cylinder (using thermodynamic principles), valves (modeled as a single-degree-of-freedom mass-spring system), plenum chambers, and pipelines. The model is applied to a two-stage air compressor to analyze the coupled effects of inter-stage pressure imbalance, valve dynamics, and heat transfer on compressor efficiency. The simulation reveals significant dynamic phenomena, such as transient flow reversal in the second-stage discharge valve and pressure drops caused by valve dynamics, which are quantified in the p-V diagrams. The results contribute to the development of more efficient and reliable multi-stage reciprocating compressor systems for industrial applications.

title: Dual-port and Dual Polarized Slot Array for X Band Applications
authors: Marija Milijic, Branka Jokanovic
publish: 2025 17th International Conference on Advanced Technologies, Systems and Services in Telecommunications (TELSIKS)
abstract: The paper presents the design of a dual-port and dual-polarized eight-element linear antenna array intended for operation in the X frequency band. The antenna is excited through two orthogonal feeding structures: the first employs series feeding via a coplanar waveguide transmission line positioned along the array on the top surface of the substrate, while the second utilizes a microstrip corporate network implemented on the bottom surface of the substrate. The antenna comprises two layers on single substrate making antenna array modeling and fabrication simple and cost effective. The antenna is characterized by port-to-port isolation higher than 22 dB, maximum gain around 17.5 dBi and side lobe suppression better than 19 dB when the excitation is by the microstrip network with the tapered distribution.

title: Hidden Markov Model-Based Weighted Graph Representation for Bearing Fault Diagnosis with Graph Attention Networks
authors: Ruichao Yuan, Hang Wang, Yuanyuan Zhou, Zhongding Fan, Huaiwang Jin, Yongbin Liu
publish: 2025 International Conference on Equipment Intelligent Operation and Maintenance (ICEIOM)
abstract: Rolling bearings serve as critical components in rotating machinery, where their operational condition significantly impacts overall equipment safety and reliability, making accurate fault diagnosis crucial. While deep learning approaches have advanced bearing fault diagnosis, current methods still face limitations in feature extraction comprehensiveness and interpretability. To overcome these challenges, this study proposes a graph attention network incorporating Hidden Markov Model (HMM)-weighted path graph for end-to-end bearing fault diagnosis. Specifically, bearing vibration signals are segmented and transformed into path graphs, where edge weights are assigned using HMM modelling. These weighted graphs are then processed by the graph attention network for diagnostic classification. Experimental results demonstrate that the proposed HMM-weighted path graph construction method outperforms alternative approaches, significantly enhancing bearing fault diagnosis accuracy.

title: LT-1 Satellite On-Orbit Centroid Estimation Accuracy Analysis
authors: Bingliang Zhang, Shuangling Li, Chun Wei, Shenxin Xu, Yueying Wu
publish: 2024 5th China International SAR Symposium (CISS)
abstract: LT-1 satellite system flying-around formation interferometry has a high requirement for the accuracy of interplanetary baseline measurements, and the analysis and calculation of the accuracy of interplanetary baseline measurements are affected by the accuracy of the centroid estimates for the entire satellite. To ensure the accuracy of satellite-to-satellite baseline measurement, the centroid estimation accuracy of LT-1 satellite was analyzed and calculated. According to actual calibration on orbit, the satellite centroid accuracy met expectations.

title: Multimodal Acoustic Feature Fusion with Hybrid Deep Networks for Industrial Equipment Fault Detection
authors: Xu Wang, Hui Zhou, Yanjie Xu, Yingtao Zhang, Zhenguo Nie
publish: 2025 International Conference on Equipment Intelligent Operation and Maintenance (ICEIOM)
abstract: Early detection of malfunctions in industrial machinery is critical for minimizing downtime and ensuring production efficiency. Although deep learning approaches based on acoustic signals have shown promising results, many existing models rely on single-feature inputs or lack robustness in noisy environments—limiting their effectiveness in real-world factory settings. In this study, we propose AFT-Net (Acoustic Fusion Transformer Network), a deep learning framework that integrates convolutional, recurrent, and attention-based components to robustly detect machine faults from acoustic signals under varying noise conditions. To enhance feature diversity and improve discriminative capability, AFT-Net fuses three complementary audio representations: Mel spectrograms, MFCCs (Mel-frequency cepstral coefficients), and spectral contrast. These features respectively capture perceptual frequency energy distributions, spectral envelope structures, and harmonic–noise patterns. The fused multimodal representation is processed through a hierarchical architecture composed of convolutional encoders for local time–frequency pattern extraction, a bidirectional Long Short-Term Memory (LSTM) for sequential dependency modeling, and a Transformer encoder to capture global contextual relationships via self-attention. This design significantly improves the model’s ability to detect subtle and temporally extended fault anomalies. Experimental results demonstrate that the method achieves high classification accuracy and remains robust across diverse machine sound anomalies, confirming its practicality for real-world industrial applications.

title: CDADCLIP: Learning Prompts with Hybrid Semantic Fusion for Few-Shot Anomaly Detection under Domain Shift
authors: Ran An, Jiafeng Tang, Zhibin Zhao, Xuefeng Chen
publish: 2025 International Conference on Equipment Intelligent Operation and Maintenance (ICEIOM)
abstract: Few-shot anomaly detection (FSAD) aims to identify anomalies using models trained on minimal samples, a task made particularly challenging in real-world scenarios due to domain shifts caused by variations in lighting conditions, object pose, and other environmental factors. Recently, large pre-trained vision-language models like CLIP have shown promise in FSAD visual tasks. However, most of existing approaches often rely on manually designed prompts to capture anomaly semantics, which are susceptible to environmental interference and labor-intensive to implement. To address this issue, we propose a cross-domain CLIP for anomaly detection (CDADCLIP) to adapt CLIP for FSAD under conditions with domain shift. CDADCLIP incorporates domain-invariant learnable prompts into CLIP to model normal and abnormal semantics. Furthermore, a Hybrid Semantic Fusion (HSF) module is utilized to enhance anomaly detection performance by integrating region-level information with global features. Experimental results on the AeBAD-S dataset with domain shift demonstrate the superior performance of our method compared with existing state-of-the-art methods.

title: LLM-Augmented Symptom Analysis for Cardiovascular Disease Risk Prediction: A Clinical NLP Approach
authors: Haowei Yang, Ziyu Shen, Junli Shao, Luyao Men, Xinyue Han, Jing Dong
publish: 2025 19th International Conference on Complex Medical Engineering (CME)
abstract: Timely identification and accurate risk stratification of cardiovascular disease (CVD) remain essential for reducing global mortality. While existing prediction models primarily leverage structured data, unstructured clinical notes contain valuable early indicators. This study introduces a novel LLMaugmented clinical NLP pipeline that employs domain-adapted large language models for symptom extraction, contextual reasoning, and correlation from free-text reports. Our approach integrates cardiovascular-specific fine-tuning, prompt-based inference, and entity-aware reasoning. Evaluations on MIMIC-III and CARDIO-NLP datasets demonstrate improved performance in precision, recall, F1-score, and AUROC, with high clinical relevance ($\mathbf{k a p p a} \boldsymbol{=} \mathbf{0. 8 2}$) assessed by cardiologists. Challenges such as contextual hallucination, which occurs when plausible information contracts with provided source, and temporal ambiguity, which is related with models struggling with chronological ordering of events are addressed using prompt engineering and hybrid rule-based verification. This work underscores the potential of LLMs in clinical decision support systems (CDSS), advancing early warning systems and enhancing the translation of patient narratives into actionable risk assessments.

title: Optimizing Bitcoin Anomaly Detection: A Comparative Analysis of Feature Selection Techniques
authors: Yahia Achraf, Mouhssine Yassine, Abdelkader Elalaoui, Said Ouatik Elalaoui, El Meslouhi Fadoua
publish: 2025 11th International Conference on Optimization and Applications (ICOA)
abstract: This paper investigates the efficiency of feature selection methods in the context of enhancing unsupervised anomaly detection in cryptocurrency markets. By taking into account historical Bitcoin data from 2013 to 2024, we make use of a process involving data normalization, feature importance selection, and model evaluation to do research. We preprocess several features comprising price returns, trading volume, and market capitalization and also generate technical indicators such as volatility and momentum metrics. We perform feature importance by two methods: Principal Component Analysis (PCA) and Random Forest feature importance that are mutually supportive. Later on, we measure the detection performance of Isolation Forest and Local Outlier Factor (LOF) algorithms for the different feature subsets. From our experiments, we see that the features selected by the Random Forest reached the highest model agreement (95.90%) and anomaly overlap (54.73%) that is far better than that of both the complete feature set and PCA-selected features. Short-term volatility indicator, price momentum as well as the number of trades appeared as very informative features for the detection of market anomalies. Theadetected anomalies were in line with Bitcoin market major events such as the period of 2017-2018 bubble burst, March 2020 market crash, and 2021's bull run. These results show that if feature subsets are precisely chosen, they can improve anomaly detection consistency in cryptocurrency markets and can even supply market surveillance and risk management systems with new insights.

title: Quantifying uncertainties related to reverse logistics implementation: state of the art
authors: Dnaya Soukaina, El Bouzekri El Idrissi Adiba, Amina El Yaagoubi
publish: 2025 11th International Conference on Optimization and Applications (ICOA)
abstract: It’s been over six decades that Reverse Logistics (RL) appeared as a research area, and it is emerging again and again in the scientific fields. As RL present real potential for value recovery and environmental impacts decreases, it’s still necessary to extend this concept more in the industrial and commercial field especially in developing countries. The process of RL is a progression of steps beginning with the customer and finishing with the organization or even the customer, however the issue is that this cycle must be adjustable to the organization concerned, in addition of legislative, operational, financial and social obstacles. Literature had demonstrated that there are many other barriers and uncertainties while the implementation of this process that vary in function of the sector concerned and the kind of activity. Besides, even if the literature on this topic has grown in recent years, it remains focused on specific sectors and has not yet been widely generalized, mainly due these persistent uncertainties. Our paper aims to help bridge this gap by providing a state-of- the-art review that identifies methods for uncertainties quantification (UQ) in RL processes. The goal is to support researchers in developing solutions that facilitate the implementation of RL.

title: Hilbert-Huang Transform-Based Deep Learning to Detect False Data Injection Attacks in Smart Energy Island
authors: Moslem Dehghani, Mokhtar Aly, Sayed M. Said, Doaa Abdelhameed, Jose Rodriguez
publish: 2025 IEEE Conference on Power Electronics and Renewable Energy (CPERE)
abstract: In recent years, there has been an increase in security breaches, making cybersecurity a significant concern in cyberspace. In smart grids, the Internet of Things (IoT) adds a range of protocols that constantly result in numerous zero-day attacks. In recent years, much attention has been paid to cybersecurity due to the advancement of deep learning (DL) in different areas related to big data. DL can extract high-level characteristics to detect new attacks and small mutations in cyberspaces. In this paper, a smart false data injection attack (FDIA) detection method for smart islands is presented by using the Hilbert-Huang transform (HHT) to extract features to be used as the inputs of deep neural networks (DNNs). This method extracts statistical features from the information by preprocessing it with HHT. Once all information has been input into DNNs, manipulated data is developed. A comparison of the efficiency of the deep model with conventional machine learning methods demonstrates that the suggested attack diagnosis system is more useful in detecting attacks than conventional approaches.

title: Tariff and Grid Constrained Optimal Control Law Design for Intelligent Charging of Electric Vehicles
authors: Ikram Barki, Hicham Hihi, Naoufal Bella
publish: 2025 11th International Conference on Optimization and Applications (ICOA)
abstract: This work is part of the energy transition and aims to optimize the charging of electric vehicles in an intelligent residential environment. Based on a rigorous modeling of the system integrating technical network constraints, battery characteristics and user preferences, two strategies for predictive control with MPC are being developed: a Basic version focused on energy cost minimization, and an Advanced version integrating peak power control. Implemented in MATLAB and tested on a realistic scenario incorporating dynamic pricing and a sliding recharge horizon, these approaches show complementary performances: the first stands out for its economic efficiency, the second for its ability to smooth load and preserve network stability. The algorithm adapts dynamically to system conditions, guaranteeing reliable, optimized recharging in line with user objectives. This study offers a flexible, modular and evolutive solution, ready to be deployed in on-board (vehicle) or stationary (Charging Points) architectures and provides a solid basis for the future development of intelligent charging strategies integrating multiple vehicles, uncertainties or learning mechanisms.

title: Adaptive Traffic Signal Control for Urban Intersections Using Riccati-Based Linear Quadratic Regulator Enhanced by LSTM-Based Traffic Flow Prediction
authors: Do Thanh Thai, Quang Tran Minh
publish: 2025 24th International Symposium on Communications and Information Technologies (ISCIT)
abstract: Efficient traffic signal control is essential for mitigating congestion and enhancing urban mobility. This study presents a hybrid control framework for coordinating signalized intersections, combining adaptive Linear Quadratic Regulator (LQR) with deep learning-based traffic state prediction. The traffic network is modeled as a discrete-time state-space system, where signal timings are optimized in real time via online solutions to the Riccati equation. A pre-trained Long ShortTerm Memory (LSTM) network forecasts short-term traffic states, such as vehicle density and speed, which informs and improves the controller's responsiveness to upcoming conditions. Simulations conducted in the Simulation of Urban MObility (SUMO) environment, based on a realistic sketch of a highdensity urban roundabout in Ho Chi Minh City, demonstrate that the proposed method outperforms traditional Riccati and Riccati+LQR controllers. Compared to the Riccati baseline, the LSTM-enhanced controller achieves a 7.9 % increase in average speed, a 29.39 % reduction in average trip duration, a 57.97 % decrease in waiting time, and a 42.64 % reduction in time loss, while maintaining consistent vehicle throughput. These results highlight the potential of combining classical optimal control with deep learning for scalable, data-driven traffic management in smart cities.

title: Study on the Impact of High-pass Filter-based Virtual Inertia Control on Power System Frequency Stability
authors: Mingze Gao, Jun Zhou, Wang Meng, Xingwei Tian, Cong Peng, Pengju Sun
publish: 2025 4th International Conference on Energy and Electrical Power Systems (ICEEPS)
abstract: Against the backdrop of high-proportion new energy sources integrated into power grids, virtual inertia control has emerged as a critical approach to enhancing the frequency stability of power systems. This paper first establishes a fourth-order frequency response model for virtual inertia control with a high-pass filter and simplifies it to a second-order model using the Routh reduction method. By comparing the simulation results of the second-order model with those of the actual electromechanical transient model, it is demonstrated that the second-order model can accurately reflect the key frequency transient characteristics of the practical system, including maximum frequency deviation and steady-state deviation. Building on this, the sensitivity of the virtual inertia parameter K<inf xmlns:mml="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">w</inf>, low-pass filter time constant T<inf xmlns:mml="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">p</inf>, and high-pass filter time constant T<inf xmlns:mml="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">w</inf> to the system's maximum frequency deviation is analyzed. Simulations reveal the influence patterns of these parameters on the system's frequency stability. Additionally, the important role of introducing the high-pass filter in eliminating the long-term drift of additional power from virtual inertia and avoiding miscompensation is further elucidated, providing theoretical guidance for engineering practice.

title: The Impact of APOE Gene on Brain Age Prediction in Alzheimer’s Disease Based on Tau Protein Deposition and Metabolic Brain Networks
authors: Ronghua Ling, Jingqiu Kuang, Haowen Zhang, Yijie Lin, Juanjuan Jiang, Ruiqin Ge, Yinghui Yang
publish: 2025 19th International Conference on Complex Medical Engineering (CME)
abstract: Alzheimer’s disease, one of the diseases affecting the health problems in the elderly population, is pathologically characterized by abnormal aggregation of Tau proteins. As brain age prediction techniques have advanced, researchers have increasingly turned to the brain’s biological age as means to gauge the risk of neurodegenerative changes and cognitive decline, with the brain age gap serving as a key metric for assessing brain aging. In this study, based on the ADNI database, a variety of regression models were applied to predict the brain age of AD patients by preprocessing Tau-PET and T1-weighted MRI images of 310 subjects (NC, MCI, and AD patients), constructing a brain network, and extracting key features. The results showed that the multiple linear regression and random forest regression models performed excellently in terms of prediction accuracy and model fit, with mean absolute errors (MAE) of 4.16 and 4.19 years and coefficients of determination of 0.40 and 0.39, respectively. In addition, the present study found that the APOE 4 gene carrier status had a significant effect on brain age disparity. Individuals carrying the APOE 4 gene exhibited a greater brain age gap, and this effect was especially significant in subjects carrying two APOE4 alleles.

title: CNN-BisLSTM-Attention: A Hybrid Prediction Model for Key Parameters of Aero-Engines
authors: Zhou Su, Chuanjin Han, Shouqiang Kang, Datong Liu
publish: 2025 International Conference on Equipment Intelligent Operation and Maintenance (ICEIOM)
abstract: This paper presents CNN-BisLSTM-Attention, a hybrid model for predicting key parameters of aero-engines. The architecture integrates two core modules: (1) A spatio-temporal feature extraction module combining convolutional neural networks for local spatial patterns and bidirectional stabilized long short-term memory (BisLSTM) for long-term dependencies; (2) A self-attention feature enhancement module introducing a multi-head self-attention mechanism to optimize discriminative feature weights. Real data from aero-engines are applied to validate the performance of the model. Experimental results manifest that the CNN-BisLSTM-Attention model outperforms the comparison models in prediction accuracy. Specifically, for MAE and RMSE indicators, the proposed model improved by 18.6%-46.0% and 14.4%-43.5%, respectively. Additionally, ablation studies prove the contributions of each component of the proposed hybrid prediction model.

title: Characteristic Analysis and Displacement Control of Magnetic Drive System for Magnetic Levitation Conveyor
authors: Xin Wang, Chuan Zhao, Shuoyu Wang, Junjie Jin, Feng Sun
publish: IEEE Transactions on Magnetics
abstract: The magnetic levitation conveyor system consists of two primary components: the levitation system and the drive system. This article proposes a drive system for a long stroke magnetic levitation conveyor. The mover has the characteristics of low mass, high-frequency noise suppression, fast dynamic response, and low disturbance. First, the no-load magnetic field model is developed using the equivalent surface current method. Subsequently, the parameters of the drive system are modeled and analyzed. Utilizing these parameters as fundamental inputs, a state-space equation for the system is established. Furthermore, to account for the mechanical and electrical coupling of the bilateral mover, parameter asymmetry and mutual-inductance coupling are incorporated into the state-space equations, resulting in a model of the drive system. The open-loop response is analyzed to reveal the inherent characteristics and dynamic behaviors of the drive system. Finally, based on the inherent characteristics of the drive system, the fractional-order proportional-integral-derivative (FOPID) controller is designed for displacement and speed control. Moreover, the particle swarm optimization (PSO) algorithm is employed to optimize multiple controller parameters. Experimental results demonstrate that the controller parameters optimized using the PSO algorithm ensure stable displacement control. Additionally, the displacement precision of the magnetic drive system is enhanced by the FOPID controller. Experimental verification confirms that the analytical model achieves high computational accuracy.
